transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Back to Back meetings: Guidelines and tools for preparation of comprehensive National strategic plans for control and Eradication of PPR & FMD regional progress Meeting.

description.narrative: During this conference, the global strategy for the control and eradication of PPR was presented. This strategy included the organization of regional meetings under the GF-TADs (global framework for the control of transboundary animal diseases) for the development of regional roadmaps to commit countries to harmonize and synchronize the fight against the disease, ensured the assessment and continuous monitoring of PPR situation and the harmonize the application of the overall PPR control strategy and eradication worldwide.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Regional NPPO and Partners Taskforce meeting for CPM-13

description.narrative: The meeting aims to give an opportunity to West Africa NPPOs taskforce to discuss regional priorities and agree on subjects of concerns and common positions to address during the Commission on Phytosanitary Measures (CPM-13) meeting planned from April 16-20, 2018 in Rome-Italy. Program content includes.- West Africa NPPO taskforce priorities.- Presentation of North American Plant Protection Organization (NAPPO) experience.- Review and discuss West Africa NPPO taskforce mission and action plan for 2018.- Review and discuss on priority plant protection issues in West Africa .- Preparation of the upcoming Commission on Phytosanitary Measures (CPM-13) .- Review CPM-12 report and Review of pending disputes .- Identify, discuss and Agree on common subjects and positions to address during the (CPM-13). .Having the opportunity to discuss subjects of concerns and common positions to address during the CPM meeting has been a big challenge for West Africa NPPOs for many years. Thus, with this meeting APHIS wish to initiate a regional consultation process to help promote regional harmonizati

Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Agricultural Quarantine Inspection User Fee Account

description.narrative: The Food for Progress Program provides for the donation of U.S. agricultural commodities to developing countries and emerging democracies that are committed to introducing or expanding free enterprise in their agricultural economies. The program has two primary strategic objectives: (1) increase agricultural productivity and (2) expand trade of agricultural products.

description.narrative: The McGovern-Dole program provides for the donation of agricultural commodities and the provision of financial and technical assistance to improve the education, food security and health of school-age children, especially girls, in developing countries.
